alert.note: Alert for Apache; Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 01 at 2:23PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NEAR SHOW LOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM MST/630 PM MDT/ THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southern Navajo County near Show Low in northeast Arizona. * WHEN...Until 530 PM MST /630 PM MDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Ponding of water on highways and in populated areas will create hazardous travel conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 221 PM MST /321 PM MDT/, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.25 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Silver Creek, Show Low Creek, Billy Creek, Porter Creek, Rocky Arroyo and Brown Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Show Low, Scott Reservoir Campground and Fool Hollow Lake Campground. - This includes the following highways... State Route 260 between mile markers 345 and 346. Highway 60 between mile markers 340 and 354. State Route 61 between mile markers 353 and 354. State Route 77 between mile markers 343 and 349. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
